column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Drew clear by 6l here at end of last season and now 4-8 over hurdles; may progress again
column37: Drew 6l clear of Whatsupwithyou on New course here (2m4f, good) at end of last season and is now 4-8 over hurdles; subsequent 8lb rise asks quite a lot of him but further progress is possible.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: In good form in early part of year but resumes on career-high mark; had summer wind op
column37: Had jumping issues over fences last autumn (albeit still managed a win); reverted to hurdling in good form after the turn of the year but resumes on a career-high mark and needs summer wind surgery to enable improvement.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Good second at Kempton in February but younger rivals look better handicapped here
column37: Ran big race behind Saint Anapolino at Kempton (2m5f, good to soft) in February and subsequent Punchestown festival defeat is not viewed harshly but younger rivals look better handicapped here; cheekpieces removed.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column27: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
column36: Collected good prize in July (2m1f) and has remained in good form; unexposed over 2m4f
column37: Collected good prize at Bellewstown (2m1f, good) in July and has remained in good form since; kept on from poor position to take third in Listed handicap at Listowel (2m, good to yielding) last month and could plausibly have untapped potential over 2m4f; shortlisted.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column27: J Magnien, C Magnien & B Magnien
column36: Won Grand Annual Chase here in March; not obviously well handicapped over hurdles
column37: Dual Festival winner here, more recently in Grand Annual Chase (2m, good to soft) this year; stays 2m4f but was not at best in Galway Plate on latest outing (in July) and is not obviously well handicapped over hurdles.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Made very good progress in early 2025 and may improve again this season
column37: Made very good progress in early part of this year, looking well suited by step up to 2m5f (from 2m) when completing hat-trick at Kempton (good to soft) in February; below form after making jumping error there in March but may improve again this season; respected.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column27: Natton House Thoroughbreds & Mr G Bishop
column32: M Baker, K Ibberson And H Pearman
column36: Off since staying-on third in major handicap in February but well worth another go at 2m4f
column37: Began last season in excellent form, notably when winning Gerry Feilden at Newbury (2m, good to soft); off since staying on to snatch third in William Hill Hurdle there (2m, soft; first-time cheekpieces) in February but, on that evidence, he's well worth another crack at 2m4f; no headgear today.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Very promising novice last season; fell on handicap debut; remains of strong interest
column37: Quickly developed into a useful novice hurdler last season, winning twice over 2m3f; yet to play his hand when falling just after third-last flight on recent seasonal/handicap debut at Chepstow; still has significant potential and remains of strong interest.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Out of form at end of last season and has a lot more to prove than some of these
column37: Won Grade 2 novice here (2m5f, good to soft) in November 2023 and returned from long layoff with quite encouraging run in January but subsequent form was very disappointing; others have much less to prove.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Did well for Olly Murphy last season but makes stable debut from fairly tough mark
column37: Won four times for Olly Murphy last September-April (2m3f-2m4f) and signed off for him with respectable third at Bangor (2m7f, good) last month but remains on fairly tough mark for stable debut; cheekpieces refitted.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Veteran who has often run well at this track and has won under today's 10lb claimer
column37: Veteran who has often run well at this track, most recently when second to East India Express on New course (2m4f, good) at end of last season; won under 10lb claimer Elliott England in February; each-way claims.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column27: E A R L Arnaud Vasselin
column36: Fourth in two major 2m handicaps last season but, on balance, others appeal more
column37: Fourth in Greatwood Hurdle here (2m, good) last November and kept on from poor position to fill same spot in Imperial Cup at Sandown (2m, good to soft) in March; unexposed over 2m4f but, on balance, others appeal more.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column81: 15:00 | Cheltenham | Un Sens A La Vie

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Bettered low-key stable debut when second at Bellewstown; might kick on again
column37: Half-brother to Altior; didn't make the progress that might have been expected for Nicky Henderson season but bettered his underwhelming stable debut when second of 13 at Bellewstown (2m4f, good) in August and may improve again for John McConnell.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Ran well at Punchestown festival in April but has very mixed record in recent seasons
column37: Won big-field handicap off today's mark here (2m5f, good to soft) in November 2023 and was creditable sixth of 25 at Punchestown festival (2m3f, yielding) in April but his record between those two runs if very mixed and he's not an easy one to predict.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Won Lingfield maiden by 9l in February; further progress required here
column37: Improved with experience over hurdles last season and won Lingfield maiden (2m3f, soft) by 9l in February; makes handicap debut after eight-month absence and in a much tougher race; further progress required.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: 2-4 over hurdles; ended up with too much to do on handicap debut; still unexposed
column37: 2-4 since switched to hurdling this term; ended up with too much to do when ridden very patiently in valuable series final at Worcester (2m4f, good) last month but remains open to improvement.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Made all on recent handicap debut; hiked up in grade but still has potential
column37: Unexposed 5yo who is a half-brother to stable's top-class hurdler The New One; made all to beat six rivals on recent handicap debut at Stratford (2m2f, good); hiked up in grade here but still has potential.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column32: The Old Stag Racing Sy Partnership
column36: Ran very well at Chepstow this month but upped in grade today and faces a tough task
column37: Career-best form when winning at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good) in July and also ran very well when fourth at Chepstow (2m3f, good) this month but moves up in grade and faces a tough assignment here; 1lb wrong.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle
column20: 5/1 French Ship, 8/1 Navajo Indy,  East India Express, 10/1 Classic King,  Bowensonfire,  Saint Anapolino, 14/1 The Expensive One,  Service Minimum,  Sign Again,  Whatsupwithyou,  Jazzy Matty, 16/1 Montecam,  Last Rodeo, 20/1 Tintintin, 25/1 Prince Imperial,  American Sniper, 33/1 Minella Missile,  Stoner's Choice,  Supreme Yeats,  Knight Templar
column36: Absent since well held on handicap debut in January; moves up in trip in a tough race
column37: Fair Flat racer; took pretty well to hurdling last season and won quite valuable juvenile event at Kempton (2m, good to soft) just after Christmas but absent since well beaten on handicap debut in January (found to have irregular heartbeat) and moves up in trip in a tough race here; 3lb wrong.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column36: Five handicap chase wins since May; further improvement is possible but necessary today
column37: Highly progressive over fences, making it five handicap wins for the campaign (2m, good/good to soft) when making all in three-runner race at Newton Abbot last time; further progress is possible but necessary in this warm contest; can jump to the right.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column36: Won Grade 3 novice at Punchestown last week and he's a key player today
column37: Won two in a row this summer when back over fences (2m2f/2m1f, good) and landed a Grade 3 novice at Punchestown (2m2f, good to yielding) last week; seems versatile ground-wise and he's a key player today.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column36: Something to find but top Irish trainer has won the last two runnings; worth a second look
column37: Soft-ground maiden hurdle winner who has improved with each of his three runs over fences and won at Sligo (2m1f, good to yielding) this month; he has something to find today but this 6yo is worth a second look given his respected Irish trainer has won the last two runnings.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column32: Mrs A Williams And A Badri
column36: Morebattle Hurdle runner-up who made winning chase debut and he's one to consider
column37: Runner-up in the Morebattle Hurdle at Kelso (2m, good to soft) in March and made all from Country Mile in three-runner beginners' chase at Uttoxeter (2m, good) recently on first chase start; now 5lb worse off with the runner-up for about 4l; could have more to offer over fences and one to consider.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column36: Won on recent chase debut; others have stronger form but he could have more to offer
column37: Third of six in Grade 2 novice hurdle at Punchestown (2m1f, soft) in January and tapped back into that promise to win on recent chase debut at Fairyhouse (2m, yielding); others have more substance to their form and King Of Kingsfield looks the yard's chief hope, but this point winner could have more to offer over fences and is not ruled out.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column36: Course novice hurdle winner who could built upon his chase debut second behind Alnilam
column37: Point runner-up and bumper winner who won two novice hurdles last season (2m/2m1f, good to soft), including here, and also ran well on soft ground; beaten just under 4l by Alnilam when second of three on his recent chase and seasonal debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good) but he's 5lb better off with the winner today and could improve for that latest run; firmly in calculations.

column4: Holland Cooper 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Country Mile, 9/4 King Of Kingsfield, 5/1 Alnilam, 7/1 Relieved Of Duties, 8/1 Addragoole, 12/1 Centara, 14/1 Cloonainra
column36: 1-1 over fences; open to further improvement in this sphere but it's needed against males
column37: Point and two-time hurdle winner (2m2f, soft/good) who won on her chase debut in a mares' novice at Listowel (2m3f, yielding) last month; she looked better than ever on that latest start and is open to further improvement in this sphere, but it's needed against some very talented males.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Career-best form at Cartmel this summer; well held last time; still on tough mark
column37: Probably posted career-best performance when bagging good prize at Cartmel (2m1f, good to soft; refitted cheekpieces) in June but did not fire on latest outing and looks vulnerable under top weight here.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Dual novice winner at start of this year; should have improvement to come in handicaps
column37: Dual novice winner at start of this year (2m, good to soft/soft); found Aintree festival Grade 1 far too strong in April but is in calmer waters here and should have improvement to come in handicaps this season.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Won valuable Summer Hurdle at Market Rasen; this track also suits; in the mix
column37: Led close home to win valuable Summer Hurdle at Market Rasen (2m, good) in July and was close fourth in another competitive handicap over that C&D (good) last month; also suited by this track; probably won't be far away.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Didn't run badly in recent Welsh Champion Hurdle but needs to see this out more strongly
column37: Ran well before fading into sixth behind King William Rufus on New course here (2m1f, good) in April and this month's fifth in Welsh Champion Hurdle at Chepstow (2m, good) wasn't a bad effort but he'll need to see this race out more strongly.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column27: L Dulong, R Bonaventure & B Dulong
column36: Held on gamely on New course here in April needs another career-best run today
column37: Two wins last season, the latter when holding on gamely in 16-runner handicap on New course here (2m1f, good) in April; needs another career-best performance today but still enters calculations.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column27: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
column36: Consistent since last autumn but has little margin for error off current mark
column37: Scores good marks for his consistency for Fergal O'Brien since last autumn but is yet to win for this stable and appears to have very little margin for error off current mark.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Bids for hat-trick after wins at Sligo and Galway; this race looks stronger
column37: Back in good form since returning from a break in June and bids to complete a hat-trick after wins at Sligo (2m2f, good) and Galway (2m, yielding); produced good late surge to lead close home under Eoin Staples on latter occasion but this race looks stronger.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Quite progressive in handicaps last season (two wins) and still only a 5yo
column37: Quite progressive in handicaps last season, winning twice at Huntingdon (2m/2m4f); absent since a lesser effort at Kempton in February but is only a 5yo and has plenty of scope for further improvement this season.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Only fourth on handicap hurdle debut in December but in good form on Flat this year
column37: 2-2 in novice hurdles last autumn; only fourth on handicap hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) in December and moves up in grade here but posted some commendable performances on the Flat this year, perhaps most notably when placed in Northumberland Plate; high on the list.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Won valuable series final in March but needs recent wind op to help her kick on again
column37: Landed valuable series final for mares at Kelso (2m, good to soft) in March but was just a respectable third of five at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good to soft) last month and needs subsequent wind surgery to help her kick on again.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Very unexposed 4yo who comfortably won a maiden on his British debut; handicap debut today
column37: Very unexposed 4yo who won Wincanton maiden (1m7f, good; first-time hood) comfortably in March on British debut; managed only third when odds-on to follow up at Chepstow in April and needs to learn to settle better but moves into handicaps with significant potential and Freddie Keighley looks very good value for his 8lb claim against other conditionals.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Third at Downpatrick in first two handicaps; needs improvement here but that's possible
column37: 0-6 in bumpers; won comfortably on hurdle debut at Downpatrick (2m2f, good) in July and has finished third in two small-field handicaps there since (2m6f/2m1f); needs improvement here but is not yet fully exposed.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column32: Ursa Major Ltd & Hicky Parmar Racing
column36: Won twice in early part of this season but may find this too competitive
column37: 4-21 over hurdles, the latest win gained at Market Rasen (2m, good) in July; behind Grey Skies when fourth at Cartmel in August and recent Flat form is uninspiring; may find this too competitive.
column66: 15:00 | Cheltenham | Un Sens A La Vie

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Well beaten in recent Welsh Champion Hurdle and this is another tough assignment
column37: Largely in good form in run-of-the-mill handicaps since the spring (two wins) but was well beaten (albeit from 5lb out of the weights) in recent Welsh Champion Hurdle and faces another tall order here.

column4: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qual)
column20: 5/1 Rubber Ball, 6/1 King William Rufus,  Charging Thunder, 7/1 Torquay Road, 8/1 Cavern Club,  Zaochen Enki, 10/1 Gold For Alec, 12/1 Liverpool Knight, 14/1 Norman Fletcher,  Diamond Tipp, 16/1 Leloopa, 25/1 Fiveonefive,  Prince Quattro,  Grey Skies, 33/1 Scintillante
column36: Perked up by blinkers this summer (two wins) but patently not the force of old
column37: Perked up by blinkers this summer, winning twice, but faded into third after setting the pace in run-of-the-mill Worcester handicap (2m, good) last month and is patently not the force of old.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column27: S C E A Le Haras D'Haspel
column36: Others in here have superior bumper form but he's a likely improver over hurdles
column37: Favourite for two of his three bumpers (good to soft or good), winning the first and on the latest occasion finishing third under a penalty at Chepstow where they didn't go much of a gallop; others in here have superior form but he's a likely improver over hurdles.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Often travels well but doesn't always find for pressure, as on recent hurdling debut
column37: Won a Listed bumper here last season; tends to travel too strongly for his own good (races keenly) and can finish weakly, as was the case when a beaten favourite on recent hurdling debut at Uttoxeter (2m); however, a first-time hood and the possibility of a solid gallop to chase means he can't be discounted.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column32: Paddy Brennan Racing Syndicate Jack Hyde
column36: Talented gelding who pulled too hard in the recent Persian War; raw ability respected
column37: Signed off last season with a fairly strong piece of handicap form at Aintree (fourth of 17) and returned with a comfortable defeat of Jaminska; let himself down by pulling too hard in the Grade 2 Persian War at Chepstow but his raw ability is respected; if settling, he wouldn't be far away.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Improving but he's up in grade and down in trip; seems to need good ground
column37: All his best form is on good ground and he was withdrawn from a yielding-to-soft engagement; made all for wins at around 2m5f at Bellewstown and Kelso, latterly by a narrow margin; up in grade and down in trip, others appeal more.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Ready winner of two minor races; whether he's up to this level is questionable
column37: Only joined Jack Jones this summer and wasn't overly pressed to justify favouritism in minor races at Worcester (good to soft) and Stratford (good); whether he's up to this level is questionable.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column32: B Hague, Mrs W Duffus & Partner
column36: Three wins on good ground at Perth; in deeper here and softer ground could hinder
column37: Progressive 5yo judged on his hat-trick of wins on good ground at Perth, doing it readily in handicaps on his last two starts; has considerably more on his plate at this loftier level and softer ground could be an issue for him.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Bumper/maiden hurdle wins at Market Rasen, both easily; seems held in high regard
column37: Recruited for £180,000 after his point win in Ireland; has looked good on his two visits to Market Rasen, totally untroubled in winning a bumper (good to soft) and a maiden hurdle (good); in a lot deeper here but Team Twiston-Davies appear to rate him very highly.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: He's 4-6 over hurdles and the defeats have come in Class 2 handicaps at Market Rasen
column37: He's 4-6 over hurdles and the defeats have come in Class 2 handicaps at Market Rasen, and he might have won the latter one had he jumped a bit better; the cheekpieces that worked well for him on the Flat now go on for the first time in this discipline; perhaps lacks the same potential as some in here but he's respected.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Insufficient promise in two bumpers for Henrietta Knight to expect much at this level
column37: Ran in two bumpers for Henrietta Knight, beaten a big distance on Listed debut and 18l in a small field at Hereford (good); hurled into the deep end here for hurdling/stable debut.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Quite exposed now after 14 races over hurdles and would be a surprise winner
column37: Made all in a Newton Abbot novice last month (2m1f, good; has won on soft) but she was no match for Jack Hyde the time before; quite exposed now after 14 races over hurdles and would be a surprise winner.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Improving Irish mare who won a handicap last time; this demands another career best
column37: Softening ground might not be welcomed but she's an improving mare who was well on top in a Fairyhouse handicap two weeks ago (2m, yielding); this test commands another career best but that's feasible.

column4: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 Un Sens A La Vie, 4/1 Fortune De Mer, 11/2 Jack Hyde, 6/1 Sir Galahad, 12/1 Run For Mahler, 14/1 Jackson Lamb,  The Last Cloud, 16/1 Doctor Blue,  Mr McLoughlan, 25/1 Paul's Dream, 33/1 Jaminska, 100/1 Gower Spirit
column36: Faces her toughest test to date but brings momentum after good efforts in Ireland
column37: Down Royal bumper winner on good to firm and last week added an ordinary maiden hurdle for mares at Thurles (good to yielding); faces by far and away her toughest test yet but brings momentum into it.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Much improved since narrowly denied in this last year; likely to go from the front
column37: Races prominently; 13lb lower when narrowly denied by Calico in this last year but this mark is warranted judged on his subsequent improvement (very impressive in two handicap wins) and he was below his best in a Grade 1 at Aintree the final time (2m4f probably too far); much respected, especially as any rain won't bother him.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Good course form and not to be underestimated with a 7lb claimer employed
column37: Won the Grand Annual here in 2024 and went close in last season's edition of that race (5lb lower than today), after which he flew too high in a Grade 1; career-high mark is eased by the 7lb claim of Harry Atkins and he shouldn't be underestimated.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: High in the weights, some 19lb higher than for his Doncaster win three starts back
column37: Has done well since joining this yard, winning four handicaps (divided between hurdles/fences) and a career-best run to be second in a 2m Grade 1 at last season's Grand National meeting, after which he struggled in another at Punchestown; has got himself high in the weights, some 19lb higher than for his Doncaster win three starts back.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Three chase wins for Willie Mullins, whom he left for 14,000gns; out for 11 months
column37: Mostly disappointing since winning a Grade 3 2m1f handicap at Fairyhouse (soft; acts on good) in early 2024 for Willie Mullins, whom he left for 14,000gns; has been out for 11 months and watching brief seems the best approach.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Last year's winner who is on a reasonable mark but wouldn't appreciate softening ground
column37: Raced prominently before narrowly repelling Matata in this race 12 months ago and produced similar form in his last two races, when third to Brookie at Doncaster and then runner-up in the Red Rum at Aintree (ridden patiently); fully entitled to feature off this mark, though wouldn't appreciate softening ground.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Won his last two but returns to far classier company here and may be found wanting
column37: Had his troubles after such a promising start over fences for the Skeltons but he's back in the good books after small-field handicap wins at Bangor and Uttoxeter (both on good ground; effective on softer); returns to far classier company here and may be found wanting.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Fifth in last season's Grand Annual when a novice; comeback run was encouraging
column37: Dual winner over fences as a novice last season and he has Cheltenham form after finishing a 7l fifth in the Grand Annual; last month's Listowel effort was encouraging (2m1f, yielding to soft) and his yard has been banging in the winners in Ireland; clear claims with the promise of more to come.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: 7th in last season's Grand Annual; recent Kelso second could give him a fitness edge
column37: Behind a couple of these when seventh in last season's Grand Annual here but this dual chase winner has the benefit of a positive recent run at Kelso on good ground that would have been lively enough for him; should run well.

column4: squareintheair.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Calico, 4/1 Jasko Des Dames, 5/1 Matata, 6/1 Brookie, 7/1 Traprain Law, 10/1 Uncle Phil, 12/1 Third Time Lucki, 14/1 Unexpected Party, 20/1 Dr T J Eckleburg
column36: Being 5lb out of the weights is far from ideal, while record fresh is also a concern
column37: Last seen running in the Swinton Hurdle and he's a much better chaser; this is his trip but being 5lb out of the weights is far from ideal, while record fresh is also a concern.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column36: Hosed up in a handicap last time when tried in cheekpieces; new mark brings him into this
column37: Headed to Worcester four weeks ago with a record of 1-10 over hurdles but in first-time cheekpieces he showed much improved form to make all for a 17l success (2m4f, good; placed on soft); if new mark (after a 19lb hike) is a fair reflection of his ability then he should be up to this level.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column27: Mme Sarah Faulks & Mr Nigel Faulks
column36: This looks his toughest test yet but ceiling of ability is not yet exposed
column37: Has unearthed sudden improvement from somewhere to win a 2m6f Galway handicap (good to yielding) and a 2m5f novice at Downpatrick (2m5f, yielding); fell early back at Galway last time when favourite for a handicap; this looks his toughest test yet but ceiling of ability is not yet exposed.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column36: Only 1-8 over hurdles but returns to further and his peak form is right up there
column37: Posted some useful RPRs, as when only 4l behind the highly touted Davy Crockett at Listowel last month; didn't run so well in a 2m Grade 3 at Tipperary last time but has proved his stamina for this far and his peak form is right up there.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column36: Faces a much stiffer examination than when a hard-fought winner at Uttoxeter
column37: Had useful form in Ireland in a bumper and maiden hurdles; beaten at evens on British debut (2m7f) but under a positive ride back over 2m at Uttoxeter he made a lot of the running for a hard-fought win; faces a much stiffer examination here.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column36: Walked over last time after his Uttoxeter win; Flat ability commands respect
column37: Running well at a useful level on the Flat before winning comfortably on hurdling debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good), after which he enjoyed a walkover at Ludlow; given Flat ability and having shown he can jump, he's one to consider.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column32: Cherry Knoll Farm, M Ward & D Skelton
column36: Won his first two bumpers before finishing down the field in the big one here in March
column37: Winning pointer who justified a shade of odds-on in his first two bumpers, at Ayr (good to soft; by 9l) and Aintree (soft; by 2l); rejected by Harry Skelton and was 66-1 when down the field in the Champion Bumper here; nice prospect for hurdling.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column32: L Hunt, M-A Middleton, J P Romans
column36: Irish point winner; could have done with a truer pace when third in his only bumper
column37: Irish point winner who joined new connections for £140,000; beaten favourite in a Kempton bumper (soft) but could have done with a truer pace; presumably showing the right signs at home to be sent here for hurdling debut.

column4: Champions: Full Gallop Streaming On ITVX Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Arch Empire,  Dalston Lad, 9/2 Leader Crik, 5/1 Percy Shelley, 11/2 Don Virginia, 7/1 Etna Bianco, 10/1 Sporting Glance, 14/1 De Temps En Temps
column27: E A R L Du Loisir
column36: Finished a clear second in his Irish point and was bought for £160,000 soon after
column37: Finished a clear second in his Irish point and was bought for £160,000 soon after; a 4yo who receives weight off all his rivals and the stable won this last year with Potters Charm.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Dual Grimthorpe winner; on a workable mark but has become very inconsistent
column37: Won his second Grimthorpe Chase at Doncaster (3m2f, good) in March and gamely finished first at Cartmel (3m5f, good to soft) in May, only to be disqualified for losing his weight cloth; big player if judged on those heroics but has become very inconsistent; visor replaces blinkers.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Won Fontwell marathon off this mark last November; out of form at end of last season
column37: Thorough stayer who won Southern National at Fontwell (3m3f, good) off today's mark last November; ended last season with two disappointing efforts and needs to have been refreshed by six-month break.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Won 4m hunter chase here in April; still very unexposed under rules
column37: Five-time point winner; unexposed under rules and stayed on strongly to win hunter chase here (4m, good) in April but was safely held when dropped back to 3m2f for Newton Abbot handicap in May; not easy to predict today.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column27: E A R L Les Bordes De Mornay Et Al
column32: Mrs C Hanbury & Mrs H Mackenzie Smith
column36: Made bright start to chasing career but dropped out very quickly on last two outings
column37: Made bright start to chasing career in early 2024, winning at Wincanton (3m1f, good to soft) before clear second at Kempton (3m, good to soft), but dropped out of contention worryingly quickly on final two starts last season (had wind op in between) and needs to prove his wellbeing.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Has performed well in only one of his first four chases and has some questions to answer
column37: Well beaten on latest hurdling start in April and has performed well in only one of his four subsequent chases, when second in Kilbeggan beginners' event (2m4f, yielding) two starts ago; ought to be suited by today's move back up in trip but has some questions to answer.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Returned to form with two wins last month; must be considered in current mood
column37: Bounced back to form with win at Galway (2m6f, good to yielding) last month and looked in even better nick when comfortably following up at Downpatrick (2m7f, yielding) 11 days later; must be considered in current mood.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Won this race off 1lb higher last year; likely to have been primed for a repeat bid
column37: Lost his way a bit last season but returns from break on mark 1lb lower than when winning this race a year ago (good ground) and is likely to have been primed for a repeat bid.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Jumped poorly last time; has claims if judged on convincing Southwell win two runs ago
column37: Spoiled chance by jumping poorly on final appearance last season but won with considerable authority at Southwell (3m, good to soft) two starts ago and has good claims if able to repeat that performance.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Shaped well on chasing debut in August and looks interesting over this longer trip
column37: Dual point winner who came good under rules with Downpatrick hurdle (2m6f, good) win in May 2024; returned from long absence with very encouraging third on chasing debut there (2m3f, good; first-time cheekpieces) in August; remains unexposed over fences and over staying trips; interesting.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Dual chase winner last season; resumes on workable mark and with Patrick Mullins on board
column37: Dual chase winner towards end of 2024 (3m1f/3m); only third of four behind Regarde at Haydock (3m4f, good) in March but wasn't beaten far; resumes on a workable mark and with Patrick Mullins a good jockey booking.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Largely consistent over fences/hurdles but not at best on latest outing; up in grade here
column37: Largely consistent 7yo who mixes hurdling with chasing and has very good 8-31 strike-rate over jumps; not at best when back over fences at Chepstow recently, though, and moves up in grade today.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Not yet fully exposed but this is much tougher than three-runner race he won last time
column37: Front-runner who won three-runner contest at Wetherby (3m, good) in March and is now 2-6 over fences; may still have more to offer this season but reappears in a much deeper race.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Won this in 2023 but has become very inconsistent in the meantime
column37: Won this race off today's mark in 2023 but has become very inconsistent in the meantime; arguably ran better than eventual 21l defeat suggests when third of seven at Uttoxeter (3m, good; first run after wind op) last month but it's hard to tell whether he'll be on a going day here.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Second in all three chases, most recently at Warwick last month; can go well again here
column37: 3-7 over hurdles; runner-up in all three chases, most recently behind dominant front-runner at Warwick (3m, good; course record) last month; can go well again here under regular partner Lily Bradstock.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: 4-9 over fences; ran well in defeat on last two outings; each-way claims at least
column37: 4-9 over fences; creditable second in Class 2 chase at Uttoxeter (3m2f, good) this summer and filled same position behind revitalised opponent at Worcester (2m7f, good) last month; holds each-way claims at least.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Out of sorts at start of this year; need wind op/tongue-tie to prompt a revival
column37: Makes seasonal debut from a tempting mark and won't fail through lack of stamina but looked out of sorts on both outings at the start of this year and has done all his winning on soft ground; needs combination of wind surgery and first-time tongue-tie to prompt a revival.

column4: Santa - The Visit Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 6/1 The Newest One, 7/1 Regarde, 8/1 Kalanisi Flash,  Solly Attwell, 10/1 Kelce, 12/1 Harrys Hope,  Smugglers Haven,  Rockinastorm, 14/1 Ideal Des Bordes,  Awaythelad,  Unanswered Prayers, 16/1 Mole Court,  Planned Paradise,  Hung Jury,  Beaufort Scale, 20/1 Moroder, 25/1 My Gift To You, 33/1 Animal
column36: Not quite at best in spring/summer but has C&D form and returns on a workable mark
column37: Not really firing on all cylinders in early part of this season but may have benefited from a break; caused 25-1 surprise in Windsor marathon (3m4f, soft) in January and was placed off today's mark in C&D (good) amateurs' race last November; could have a say.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Has form figures of 114 since returned to 6f; beat Jubilee Walk on penultimate start
column37: Acts on any ground; formerly effective at 5f but perhaps needs 6f now; has form figures of 114 since returned to this distance, running creditably at Ascot (soft) most recently; beat Jubilee Walk by 1l there the time before; likely player.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Ties in with Brosay on penultimate effort; ran well in the Ayr Gold Cup latest; player
column37: Record of 0-7 this year but he has encouraging recent form; ties in closely with Brosay on penultimate effort and ran well, faring best of the near-side group, in the Ayr Gold Cup (6f, soft) latest; wears cheekpieces for first time on home soil; major contender.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column32: Fine Claret Racing,Mrs Burke & C Wood
column36: Remains well treated on peak form but two-year losing spell tempers enthusiasm
column37: Placed in competitive field at York most recently and remains well handicapped on peak form; however, he's still on a two-year losing spell, which tempers enthusiasm.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Made all at Pontefract on Monday, confirming that she's suited by soft ground
column37: Record of 7-24 on turf; made all at Pontefract (6f) on Monday, scoring with something to spare and confirming that she's well suited by soft ground; may well remain competitive, even with 5lb penalty.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Has a solid record at Doncaster, albeit over longer distances
column37: Solid record at Doncaster comprises two wins over 7f and two placed efforts, including over 6.5f when a shade unlucky; return to this location looks a plus but the drop back to bare 6f may prove a negative.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Last two efforts can be forgiven; record of 0-12 since debut win is the downside
column37: Placed four times for current stable and last two efforts can be forgiven (raced in the most disadvantaged group in Ayr Gold Cup latest); record of 0-12 since debut win is the downside.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Ran well in the Stewards' Cup; defied a 2lb higher mark last October; not ruled out
column37: Record of 0-11 this season but he ran well to finish second in the Stewards' Cup (four starts ago) and has become nicely handicapped; defied a 2lb higher mark at York (soft) last October; not ruled out.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column27: Seserve Sagl & S A R L European Bloodst
column36: Took well to first-time cheekpieces at Pontefract most recently; enters calculations
column37: Responded well to first-time cheekpieces in a tight finish at Pontefract (6f) most recently, taking record on soft ground to 1121331; may have more to offer in the retained headgear; successful on this card 12 months ago; enters calculations.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Record this term comprises three duck eggs; best watched
column37: Had bits of Group form as a 2yo but his record in handicaps (7f/1m) this term comprises three duck eggs; has lots to prove and may be best watched unless the market speaks positively.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Won at Ripon last time, building on his Ayr Silver Cup effort; in-form contender
column37: Acts on heavy ground; prevailed by a neck at Ripon (6f, good) most recently, building on his third-place finish in the Ayr Silver Cup and taking record to 4-21; this in-form contender is one for the shortlist.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Back in the difficult zone; gained his two wins this season off 5lb lower
column37: Wasn't helped by being hampered last time but is back in the difficult zone from a handicapping perspective; gained his two wins this season off 5lb lower, including at Ayr on penultimate start.

column4: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap
column20: 4/1 Jubilee Walk, 5/1 Brosay,  Eye Of Dubai, 6/1 Fine Interview, 7/1 Sophia's Starlight, 10/1 Strike Red,  Mister Sox, 12/1 Milford, 14/1 Korker,  Rousing Encore, 16/1 Akkadian Thunder, 25/1 Tiger Mask
column36: Ties in with Eye Of Dubai on two pieces of Ripon form this term, including last time
column37: Has form on all types of ground; narrowly beat Eye Of Dubai at Ripon in August and finished a close third to same rival back there last time; accordingly there isn't much between them; in the mix.

column37: Debutant by New Bay and first foal of 1m-1m4f winner (including 2yo debut/Listed; RPR 107) for his connections; respected.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Affettuoso, 11/4 Golden Story,  Infraad, 11/2 Arbaawy, 8/1 El Loco
column36: Sets the standard but is 0-5 and takes on some potentially useful newcomers
column37: Form includes a solid effort on soft ground; sets the standard but is 0-5 and takes on some newcomers who look potentially useful.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Affettuoso, 11/4 Golden Story,  Infraad, 11/2 Arbaawy, 8/1 El Loco
column36: Never figured in C&D maiden; may do better with that outing under his belt
column37: Never figured in C&D maiden (soft) on St Leger day, recording an ordinary RPR; however, may do better with the experience under his belt.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Affettuoso, 11/4 Golden Story,  Infraad, 11/2 Arbaawy, 8/1 El Loco
column36: Sibling to three winners for his owner, notably useful Arabian Force; likely type
column37: Lope De Vega colt; sibling to three winners for his owner, notably Arabian Force (Group-placed 1m/1m2f; RPR 112); likely type.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Affettuoso, 11/4 Golden Story,  Infraad, 11/2 Arbaawy, 8/1 El Loco
column36: 75,000gns yearling with a pretty attractive pedigree; in top hands and one to consider
column37: 75,000gns yearling; eighth foal; Starspangledbanner half-brother to winners Still Standing (1m-1m3f Flat including 2yo/Listed), and Mistressofillusion (1m2f/1m4f; 94); in top hands and he's one to consider on debut.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Affettuoso, 11/4 Golden Story,  Infraad, 11/2 Arbaawy, 8/1 El Loco
column36: Sibling to four winners for his owner, notably Nezwaah (Group 1); interesting
column37: Ghaiyyath colt; sibling to four winners for his owner, notably Nezwaah (1m-1m2f including Group 1; RPR 115); interesting debutant.

column4: Join Century Racing Club Today EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

column36: Modest fourth last time but is bred to do better still
column37: Both starts over 7f; only a modest fourth on AW latest but is bred to do better still, being half-sister to a Listed scorer for her yard.

column4: Join Century Racing Club Today EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Harper Violet, 7/2 Poets Praise, 9/2 Florida Suite,  Lilt, 10/1 Hollywell Stream,  Venetian Sky, 16/1 Accademia,  Hot And Cold, 20/1 Bluebluelectricblu
column36: Down the field at Newmarket, albeit seemed in need of the outing
column37: Down the field in Newmarket maiden (7f, good to firm; 33-1) but seemed green and in need of the outing; may do better.

column4: Join Century Racing Club Today EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Harper Violet, 7/2 Poets Praise, 9/2 Florida Suite,  Lilt, 10/1 Hollywell Stream,  Venetian Sky, 16/1 Accademia,  Hot And Cold, 20/1 Bluebluelectricblu
column36: Seemed green and in need of the run at Newbury; open to improvement
column37: Only sixth of seven in Newbury conditions race (7f, good to soft; 5-1) but seemed green and in need of the run; open to improvement; major yard also runs two debutantes.

column4: Join Century Racing Club Today EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Harper Violet, 7/2 Poets Praise, 9/2 Florida Suite,  Lilt, 10/1 Hollywell Stream,  Venetian Sky, 16/1 Accademia,  Hot And Cold, 20/1 Bluebluelectricblu

column37: Lope De Vega filly; sibling to two winners, notably Inisherin (6f/1m including Group 1; RPR 120); dam 1m2f-1m4f scorer (including Group 1; 113); from a smart family that has served her owner well; respected newcomer.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap

column37: Suited by ground softer than good; proved resurgent last time in Redcar Listed contest he'd won a year earlier; on a workable mark returned to handicap level and Jack Dace takes off a bonus 5lb; shortlisted.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap

column37: Lightly raced 4yo; campaigned mostly at 1m but his two efforts this term, including when sixth in the Lincoln here, suggest this return to 7f is worth exploring; good second at Doncaster (soft) 12 months ago; possibilities, provided he takes well to first-time headgear.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap

column37: Suited by ground softer than good but his ideal locations are Goodwood (firstly) and Epsom (secondly); on this course he's not sure to take advantage of same mark as for this year's Golden Mile win.

column37: Landed a valuable prize on soft ground last October and has shown bits of useful form this year, notably third in Ascot handicap (three starts ago); fighting chance, provided he responds well to first-time hood.

column37: Got up near the finish at Sandown (7f, soft) on penultimate start but came up well short off revised mark in the competitive Class 2 event over C&D won by Rogue Diplomat; opposed kept to this grade.

column37: Led towards the finish in competitive field at the Doncaster St Leger meeting (good to soft) last time, completing a hat-trick and taking record over 7f to 4-5; could well continue to progress over this distance; strong contender.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap

column36: Not the force of old and hasn't won for over two years
column37: Still capable of fairly useful form aged eight, albeit isn't quite the force of old and hasn't won for over two years; best efforts this term at Musselburgh; not the percentage call.

column37: Won on debut at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) in August and second of four at Ripon (6f, good to firm) ten days later; didn't run badly when fifth of eight in Group 2 Mill Reef Stakes at Newbury (6f, good to soft) last month and today's nursery debut provides a more realistic assignment; chance.

column37: Won on debut at Newmarket (5f, good to firm) in May and came clear with a useful filly when defying a penalty at Sandown (5f, good) in June; could be even better now tackling 6f and he has potential off his opening mark; wears first-time cheekpieces.

column4: William Hill Extra Places With B.O.G Nursery Handicap

column37: Won on debut at Ffos Las (6f, good) in July and faced tough task in Goodwood Group 2 (7f, good) 13 days later; however, two lesser performances have followed and he needs to get back on track.

column4: William Hill Extra Places With B.O.G Nursery Handicap
column20: Evs Rising Power, 7/2 Go Vince Go, 11/2 Gwen John, 15/2 Bye Law, 10/1 Gold Queen Kindly, 14/1 Gharma Sutra
column36: Two wins from last three starts; question mark about testing ground but still respected
column37: Won at Hamilton (6f, good to soft) last month on second nursery start and bounced back from Ayr blip (6f, soft) to win at York (5f, good) a fortnight ago; has something to prove now back on testing ground but this progressive sort is respected nevertheless.

column4: William Hill Extra Places With B.O.G Nursery Handicap

column37: Windsor novice winner (6f, good to firm) who was second of 12 on last month's nursery debut here (6.5f, good to soft; unraced on softer); failed to settle and faded at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) last time but could leave that behind now back down in trip.

column4: William Hill Extra Places With B.O.G Nursery Handicap
column20: Evs Rising Power, 7/2 Go Vince Go, 11/2 Gwen John, 15/2 Bye Law, 10/1 Gold Queen Kindly, 14/1 Gharma Sutra
column36: Testing ground poses a question but the step back up to 6f looks the right move
column37: Won Ayr maiden in August (6f, good) and followed up in Redcar novice a fortnight later (6f, good to firm); tailed off on nursery debut at Ayr (6f, soft) then denied a clear run when mid-division at York (5f, good); testing ground poses a question but the step back up to 6f looks the right move.

column37: Back to his best when seeing off 13 rivals in a Racing League handicap at Chepstow in August (6f, good); down the field in the Ayr Silver Cup five weeks ago and although he handles soft ground well, this will be his first run on heavy.

column37: Trip, track and ground all in his favour; some quiet recent runs have seen him slip back down below the mark off which he was successful here (5f) in June; one to consider.

column4: Final One Standing By William Hill Handicap

column4: Final One Standing By William Hill Handicap

column37: Prominent racer who goes well on testing ground; solid fourth at Ayr two weeks ago but he finished behind Lord Bertie on that occasion and may do so again.

column4: Final One Standing By William Hill Handicap

column4: Final One Standing By William Hill Handicap

column37: Well backed when winning a 6f novice at Newcastle on his second start; 50-1 and well beaten on his handicap debut at Ayr five weeks ago (7f, soft); plenty more needed back down in trip.

column4: Final One Standing By William Hill Handicap

column36: Two Hamilton wins last month but she looks up against it in this company
column37: Won twice at Hamilton in September (6f, good to soft and soft); not so good twice since and likely vulnerable at this level.

column37: In-form 8yo who recorded a 2l success at Pontefract (1m2f, soft) on Monday, ending two-year losing spell; incurs 4lb penalty but Jack Nicholls takes off useful 5lb; could well remain competitive.
