column37: Probably acts on heavy; AW win off 2lb higher on reappearance and there have been enough echoes of that form since, including when out of her depth in Listed race last time, for her to be given a place chance.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column36: Struggled last season and a tailed-off last on both starts for new yard this year
column37: Struggled last season and finished a tailed-off last at triple-figure odds for both starts (August/October) for new yard this year.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column36: Heavy-ground win last September; running-on third of 11 over 1m2f here gave renewed hope
column37: Won a heavy-ground novice at Epsom (1m2f) last September; needs career-best form today but his running-on third of 11 over 1m2f here (good to soft) five weeks ago gave some renewed hope.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column32: Let's Get Ready To Rumble Partnership
column36: Sole win on AW last June; six seconds, including at Epsom (1m4f, good) on latest outing
column37: Acts on soft, unraced on heavy; sole win was on Lingfield Polytrack last June; six seconds overall, including at Epsom (1m4f, good) on latest outing, but that record suggests that there are more appealing win options.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column32: Two Plus Three Two Plus Four
column36: Has had a mixed 2025 campaign but latest start was one of the better efforts
column37: Last season ended with a good run on soft; AW third last time was one of the better efforts in his mixed 2025 campaign and first-time cheekpieces (retained today) replaced blinkers on that occasion; case can be made.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column32: HM The King & HM The Queen
column36: Won twice before he disappointed at the big York and Ayr meetings on last two starts
column37: First five runs were on good to firm, including when he won at about 1m4f in small fields for a maiden and Newbury handicap; disappointed in the Melrose at York (1m6f) in August and he wasn't that much better at Ayr (1m5f, good to soft) on latest outing, so now has a point to prove.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column32: R Vaughan, R Bisiker, M Jones And S West
column36: Needs a second look, including as he won on heavy going at this meeting last year
column37: Often front-runner; two 1m6f wins under Rose Dawes this season and third of 14 at Doncaster (1m4f, good to soft) on penultimate start; not discredited from a flag start on latest, never dangerous; needs a second look, including as he won on heavy going at this meeting last year.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column36: Consistent in defeat this season; perhaps a return to the mud would boost her cause
column37: Soft-ground 2yo winner last September who has been consistent in defeat this season over 1m2f-1m6f; none of those 2025 races were on soft but latest was on good to soft; perhaps a return to the mud would boost her cause.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column36: He wasn't quite at his best three runs back on his only encounter with soft ground
column37: Won three times (April-July) during this consistent campaign and respectable second when trying 1m6f on latest outing, but he wasn't quite at that level three runs back on his only encounter with soft ground.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column36: Unraced on worse than good to soft; 1m2f wins on last two starts, rallying well for latest
column37: Twice tailed off but improved in his other four races, including narrow handicap wins (1m2f, good to soft; unraced on worse) at Redcar and Nottingham on last two outings; wore cheekpieces last five; up another 3lb today but he rallied well last time and this first attempt at 1m4f looks interesting.

column4: Donnington & Co. 10% Partner Offer Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 5/1 Mawood, 6/1 Fouroneohfever, 7/1 Miller Spirit, 8/1 Crystal Flyer,  Golden Handshake, 9/1 Forest Gate,  Macari,  Autumn's Breeze, 12/1 Midnight Rumble,  Just An Hour, 14/1 Kind Of Kiss,  Seagolazo,  Music Piece, 100/1 Oviedo
column36: Resumed her progress when third of eight here (1m4f, good to soft) five weeks ago
column37: Second on soft last October; cheekpieces going on in August saw two easy wins on good ground at Lingfield (2m/1m5f); raced too freely at Goodwood next time but resumed her progress when third of eight here (1m4f, good to soft) five weeks ago; respected on her upward curve.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Fast ground may not have suited on latest start; also a big question mark on soft or heavy
column37: Won at Hamilton (1m1f) in June before close second at Doncaster (1m2f), both on good to soft; fast ground may not have suited on latest start but there is also a big question mark over her on soft or heavy.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Won two from five, including latest; 2nd on her only run on soft; could have more to offer
column37: Flopped when trying 1m4f on AW debut on penultimate start; has done well otherwise, including with 1m2f wins in a Salisbury novice (good to firm) in May and Newmarket handicap (good) three weeks ago; second on her only run on soft; after just five races, she could have more to offer.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column32: HM The King & HM The Queen
column36: Well beaten in 1m4f Listed race; last of six at 5-4 on handicap debut (1m2f, good to soft)
column37: Made all in a novice at Newmarket (1m2f, good to soft) in August; that looked promising but she was soundly beaten in Listed event at York (1m4f, good to firm; 8-1) and last of six when 5-4 favourite on handicap debut at Ayr (1m2f, good to soft); those give cause for concern.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Made all twice in July; close last time; both runs on soft/heavy (2024) were offputting
column37: Improving in July, making all in good style at Sandown and Leicester (both 1m2f, good); creditable third over C&D (good to soft) last month and better still when beaten a head at Salisbury (1m2f, good) latest; her two runs on soft/heavy were offputting, albeit last season.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: All her success has been on AW or good to firm, with a lesser show on good to soft latest
column37: All her success has been on AW or good to firm, most recently with a narrow win when upped to 1m4f at Brighton in August; a lesser show on good to soft at Doncaster (never dangerous at 28-1) six weeks ago is a stumbling block.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Won a Newmarket novice and ran in a Listed race; a relatively unexposed handicap newcomer
column37: Won a novice at Newmarket (1m, good to firm) in August on second start; better form since in an AW novice (1m2f) and 1m Listed race (albeit in 11th of 12) and she's a relatively unexposed handicap newcomer.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Impressive wins on last two starts; stays 1m2f and acts on soft; fine chance with penalty
column37: Won handicap debut at Thirsk (1m, soft) in September and followed up at Goodwood (1m2f, good) 12 days ago; held up for both and finished powerfully to be well on top; has just a 6lb penalty (due to go up another 4lb) and that gives her an excellent chance.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Won three handicaps in 2025; form dipped, however, when she ran on good to soft last time
column37: Her first handicap win came from the rear in April and she's since scored from the front in May and July, latterly at Sandown (1m2f, good) on stable debut; her form dipped, however, when she ran on good to soft at Epsom on latest outing and she's unraced on soft or heavy.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Second in this last year on heavy; won on stable debut in June but fortunes have faded
column37: Won twice in the mud in 2023 and second in this race last year on heavy; that sparks interest and she won on stable debut (1m4f, good to soft) in June but fortunes have faded; usually wears some headgear but not today.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Runner-up in all five runs this year; needs to find a bit extra on this handicap debut
column37: Runner-up in all five runs this year, at odds of 2-9, 11-10, 10-11 and 5-4 last four occasions; that's from just six races in total and she went down by just a neck over 1m2f on last two outings (on good to soft latest, unraced on worse) but she needs to find a bit extra on this handicap debut.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: 1m2f wins on soft and good to soft on last two outings; lightly raced 3yo who is improving
column37: Dominant from the front at Sandown (1m2f, soft) last month and always prominent to score by a neck at Bath (1m2f, good to soft) 15 days ago, so now bids for a hat-trick; upped another 5lb and in class but this lightly raced 3yo is improving.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: No win on worse than good ground but a respectable 3rd on heavy at this meeting in 2024
column37: The last three of her seven wins were at Goodwood and she has never won on worse than good ground, but she was a respectable third on heavy at this meeting last year; seems flattered by margin beaten in Listed race on penultimate start but she followed that with a handicap second at same track.

column4: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Day Of Grace, 6/1 Princess Rascal,  Concert Party, 8/1 Majaz, 10/1 Aeolian,  Gloryous,  Pink Lily, 14/1 Regal Charm, 16/1 Roarin' Success,  Kimeko Glory,  Mandana, 20/1 Big Bear Hug, 25/1 Manara
column36: Second in three turf handicaps but this race may be too hot; unraced on softer than good
column37: Lingfield AW maiden (1m) in April is her one win from 13 races; better form on turf since, notably when second in three handicaps and the last two of those were at 1m2f, but this race may be too hot; unraced on softer than good.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Won here on debut then last in Listed race; respected now back down in grade under penalty
column37: 25-1 winner on debut here (6f, good to firm) in July; finished last in Listed race at Doncaster (7f, good) last month but he's respected now back down in grade under a penalty; bred to be suited by the step up in trip.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Cost 120,000gns; bred to be useful & could have a part to play under Colin Keane on debut
column37: 90,000euros foal, 120,000gns yearling; fifth foal; Phoenix Of Spain half-brother to winners Almarada Prince (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 95) and Get Set (French 7f-12.5f including 2yo; 93); bred to be useful and could have a part to play under Colin Keane on debut.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Trainer has done well with his family but he may require further than this debut trip
column37: Eighth foal; Golden Horn half-brother to winners Kyle Of Lochalsh (1m5f-2m4f; RPR 107), Sandyman (1m2f; 88) and Wagga Wagga (1m4f/1m5f; 80); dam 9.4f-1m6f winner (including 2yo/triple French Listed); trainer has done well with his family but he may require further than this debut trip.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Fourth on both starts (7.3f/7f); the step up to 1m could be a plus and he's not ruled out
column37: Kept on well for fourth on debut at Ffos Las (7.3f, good) in August; failed to build on that when fourth at Kempton (7f, AW) last month when compromised by his refusal to settle; the step up to 1m could be a plus and he's not ruled out.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: 75,000gns yearling with a pretty attractive pedigree; in top hands and one to consider
column37: 75,000gns yearling; eighth foal; Starspangledbanner half-brother to winners Still Standing (1m-1m3f Flat including 2yo/Listed), and Mistressofillusion (1m2f/1m4f; 94); in top hands and he's one to consider on debut.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column27: S A R L Haras De Dodville
column36: 25,000euros 2yo breeze-ups; dam French 1m 2yo winner; may be best watched on debut
column37: 11,000euros yearling, 25,000euros 2yo breeze-ups; third foal; dam French 1m 2yo winner, half-sister to French winners Thesee (6.5f) and Albertinelli (5.5f), out of well-bred maiden; may be best watched on debut.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: 65,000gns yearling who is open to improvement but he was well beaten on last month's debut
column37: 65,000gns yearling who is open to improvement on his second start but he was a well-beaten sixth of seven at 15-2 on last month's debut at Ascot (7f, soft) and a sizeable step forward is necessary today.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Oathbound may be top yard's chief hope but this well-bred colt is respected nevertheless
column37: Seventh foal; Kingman half-brother to four winners notably King Of Change (1m including Group 1) and Century Dream (1m-1m2f including 2yo/Group 2); dam 6f winner (RPR 89), out of 10.5f Group 3 winner; fellow newcomer Oathbound may be his top stable's chief hope under Tom Marquand but this well-bred colt is respected nevertheless.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Attractive pedigree and he's Tom Marquand's mount of the two William Haggas newcomers
column37: 130,000gns foal, 200,000gns yearling; by Kameko; fifth foal; closely related to 1m-1m3f winner Long Ago (including 2yo; RPR 109), half-brother to 6f/7f 2yo winner South Seas (including Group 3); Tom Marquand's mount of the two William Haggas newcomers and he could play a leading role.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: Dubawi half-brother to two talented winners and he's one to be interested in on debut
column37: Fourth foal; Dubawi half-brother to winners Sounds Of Heaven (1m including 2yo/Listed) and Voice Of Angels (Listed-placed 1m); dam once-raced sister to two Group 1 winners; one to be interested in on debut and the betting could be informative; trainer also saddles the once-raced Norman Invasion.

column4: Join Hot To Trot For 2026 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
column20: 9/2 Oathbound, 11/2 King Of Earth, 6/1 Electrical, 13/2 Gonna Fly, 8/1 Alma De Fuego,  Bnaider, 9/1 Qarreeb, 10/1 Norman Invasion, 12/1 Kaladan, 16/1 Ataturk,  Surrey King, 25/1 Hove Ranger
column36: 52,000gns yearling; dam 1m 2yo/1m4f Group 3 winner; he may need this debut outing
column37: 52,000gns yearling; by Palace Pier; third foal; dam 1m 2yo/1m4f Group 3 winner from a talented family; he may need this debut outing.

column4: Saturday Super Boost At BetVictor Handicap
column20: 4/1 Telemark, 5/1 Bold Impact, 7/1 Glenfinnan, 8/1 King's Lynn,  Headmaster, 10/1 Christian David,  Kodi Lion,  Uncle Don, 12/1 Tarkhan, 16/1 Champagne Powder,  Rare Change,  Echalar, 25/1 Brian
column32: R A Pegum And P A Henry
column36: Near miss over C&D on penultimate start; less good last time but return to Class 3 a plus
column37: Smart on the continent, including on testing ground; 0-9 for Jamie Osborne but he has run some good races, including a near miss over C&D last month; not so good at Ascot since but returning to Class 3 will be in his favour.

column4: Saturday Super Boost At BetVictor Handicap
column20: 4/1 Telemark, 5/1 Bold Impact, 7/1 Glenfinnan, 8/1 King's Lynn,  Headmaster, 10/1 Christian David,  Kodi Lion,  Uncle Don, 12/1 Tarkhan, 16/1 Champagne Powder,  Rare Change,  Echalar, 25/1 Brian
column36: On a good mark, handles testing ground and clear promise last time; high on the list
column37: Well suited by slow ground; attractively handicapped and his last two runs have both been promising, meeting trouble before finishing off strongly at Newcastle last month; high on the list.

column4: Saturday Super Boost At BetVictor Handicap
column20: 4/1 Telemark, 5/1 Bold Impact, 7/1 Glenfinnan, 8/1 King's Lynn,  Headmaster, 10/1 Christian David,  Kodi Lion,  Uncle Don, 12/1 Tarkhan, 16/1 Champagne Powder,  Rare Change,  Echalar, 25/1 Brian
column36: Signs of a revival at Ascot last time but he has a bit more to prove over 7f
column37: Promising 2yo for Sylvester Kirk and he made a good stable debut when fourth to Big Mojo in an Ascot Group 3 in April; less good since but he didn't run badly when midfield in a good Ascot handicap three weeks ago (6f, soft); 7f form needs bettering.

column4: Saturday Super Boost At BetVictor Handicap
column20: 4/1 Telemark, 5/1 Bold Impact, 7/1 Glenfinnan, 8/1 King's Lynn,  Headmaster, 10/1 Christian David,  Kodi Lion,  Uncle Don, 12/1 Tarkhan, 16/1 Champagne Powder,  Rare Change,  Echalar, 25/1 Brian
column36: Beat Tarkhan when scoring over C&D last month; less good over 1m latest; can bounce back
column37: Came from off the pace to beat Tarkhan over C&D (good to soft) last month; not in the same form at Haydock (1m) one week later; should give another good account.

column4: Saturday Super Boost At BetVictor Handicap

column4: Saturday Super Boost At BetVictor Handicap

column4: West Berkshire Racing Club Handicap

column4: West Berkshire Racing Club Handicap

column36: Demoted 1st at Thurles last time; cheekpieces retained; should go close but can hang left
column37: Point winner in 2024 ran too badly to be true on rules debut in a Listowel bumper (6/4 fav) in June; better over hurdles twice since, notably at Thurles last time when first past the post over 2m6f but demoted for interference; the cheekpieces worn then are retained; should go close but has a tendency to hang left.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
column20: 5/4 Additional Time, 13/8 Poetic Glory, 5/1 Phoenix Arizona, 14/1 Villagers Cross,  Strong Contender
column36: Soundly beaten in a maiden hurdle (2m) latest; needs to improve a fair bit raised in trip
column37: Showed some ability in points without winning; soundly beaten in two bumpers plus a Galway maiden hurdle (2m) latest; needs to improve a fair bit raised significantly in trip.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
column20: 5/4 Additional Time, 13/8 Poetic Glory, 5/1 Phoenix Arizona, 14/1 Villagers Cross,  Strong Contender
column36: Beaten 14l and 16l in bumpers at Galway and Listowel (hung right); go well on hurdle debut
column37: Runner-up in a point on third start in that sphere; similar efforts in defeat in two bumpers; beaten 14l at Galway and 16l behind an easy winner at Listowel (hung right); this right-handed track should suit better and is likely to go well on hurdling debut.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
column20: 5/4 Additional Time, 13/8 Poetic Glory, 5/1 Phoenix Arizona, 14/1 Villagers Cross,  Strong Contender
column36: Won't have to be a star to win this on debut but the market can be a guide

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
column20: 5/4 Additional Time, 13/8 Poetic Glory, 5/1 Phoenix Arizona, 14/1 Villagers Cross,  Strong Contender
